intro: Epicharis gotadhora, commonly known as the Gotadhora nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its dark purple to black berries, which are often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are typically broad and glossy, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. However, it is important to note that all parts of this plant are toxic and should not be ingested without proper guidance.
